text:
Spain will host the Mediterranean Resort & Hotel Real Estate Forum Published on : Wednesday, September 16, 2015
Bench Events and Questex Hospitality Group have announced that the Mediterranean Resort & Hotel Real Estate Forum 2015 (MR&H) will be hosted in Spain in collaboration with Study Let O4. The event will take place at the NH Collection Eurobuilding in Madrid from November, 9th to 11th.
Jonathan Worsley, Chairman of Bench Events, has highlighted “the increasing interest of investors in the opportunities offered by hotel and tourism industry in the Mediterranean region deserves an event of this kind’. The election of Spain as host is due to its strategic market position within this sector. ‘According to CBRE, international Real Estate consultant, hotel investment in Spain has grown 63% in 2014 to € 1.1 bn, with further growth prospects” Worsley said.
The conference will be opened by Taleb. D Rifai, General Secretary of the World Tourism Organization (UNWTO). According to UNWTO, tourist arrivals in the Mediterranean destinations will reach over 500 million in 2030. However despite the regions popularity, destinations around the Mediterranean face several challenges – economic, political and environmental.
The MR&H programme will feature 70 industry leaders, expert speakers and moderators who will be discussing the outlook for both the emerging and mature destinations in the region, the challenges these destinations face in the long-term, how they can adapt to changing market conditions and what opportunities they offer.
The programme has a number of highlights including:
Resorts – From master plan to opening – what is required? How do you make money from resort development? How to transform depressed/tired areas in the resort space. Resorts featured include Quinta do Lago, Sotogrande, Amanzoe, Eden City Cyprus, La Manga Club, Dubrovnik Sun Gardens, PGA Catalunya
The Real Investors – Who is investing and what they are looking for. Speakers include representatives from KSL Capital Partners, Colony Capital Europe, Starwood Capital Europe Advisers LLP, HI Partners, Azora and Blackstone.
Trendspotter Daniel Levine, Director from The Avant-Guide Institute – one of the world’s best-known trends experts. Daniel is the director of the Avant-Guide Institute trends consultancy, the Global Editor of the popular social trends website WikiTrend.org, and the leader of a large international team of trend spotters – over 9000 researchers who chronicle the latest ideas, products and experiences from around the globe.
Jonathan Worsley, Chairman of Bench Events commented “We are incredibly excited to be launching MR&H this year and providing a platform for private equity investors, industry captains, owners, developers, advisors and financiers to gather and drive developments in the region forward”.
